entries.meaning: A cone or pyramid whose tip has been truncated by a plane parallel to its base.
examples: In a parabolic conoid this difference vaniſhes, the fruſtum being always equal to a cylinder of the ſame height upon the ſection of the conoid that biſects the altitude of the fruſtum and is parallel to its baſes.

entries.meaning: A portion of a sphere, or in general any solid, delimited by two parallel planes.
examples: In some women it[the os uteri] is flat, in many more tuberose, and forming, as it were, a frustum of a sphere; […] .
